column4: anyone in here familiar with alsa and getting its software mixer to work?
it depends, what's up to your soundcard?
whats up to my soundcard?
are you asking what my soundcard is? or something else?
mmm, sorry scotth
I mean, you have a problem with your soundcard, do you?
its cool
Im trying to be able to play music while using team speak... my music is playing through esd and I understand that alsa supports dmix, but I can't get it to use it and provide multiple output
esd is quite outdated, isn't it?
you better use gstreamer
if I use gstreamer then I only get one output to the sound card
how comes?
plus my prefered music player is muine and it only uses 0.8.0
wich model is your soundcard?
cause muine goes through gstreamer 0.8 and then I have gstreamer to use esd... when I set it to alsa I can only play one stream at a time
Ensoniq 5880 AudioPCI
and which kernel module is loaded?
snd_ens1371
did you configure that or did ubuntu do it?
configure what? the driver? naw its a stock dapper install... very little tweaking with the hardware(which makes me very happy)
that's great, but anyway, I don't know what could happen to your sound
are you runnig gnome or kde?
